str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From sun and ago; to lead together, i.e. Collect or convene; specially, to entertain.
From en and pros; in front of (literally or figuratively) or time).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To rail off, separate, place apart. From apo and horizo; to set off by boundary, i.e. limit, exclude, appoint, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
Just as, as, even as. From hos and per; just as, i.e. Exactly like.
A shepherd; hence met: of the feeder, protector, and ruler of a flock of men. Of uncertain affinity; a shepherd.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To rail off, separate, place apart. From apo and horizo; to set off by boundary, i.e. limit, exclude, appoint, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A sheep. Probably neuter of a presumed derivative of probaino; something that walks forward, i.e., a sheep.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A goat. Perhaps from the same as erion; a kid or goat.
